meanings.definition: The state or quality of being bulky or large in size.
meanings.sent1: The bulkages of the elephant made it stand out in the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The furniture's bulkages filled up the entire room.
meanings.sent3: The bulkages of the overstuffed suitcase caused it to burst open at the airport.
meanings.sent4: The bulkages of the mountain loomed large against the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The bulkages of the old tree trunk made it difficult to move.

meanings.definition: The act of increasing in size or volume.
meanings.sent1: The bulkages of the dough as it rose in the oven were impressive.
meanings.sent2: The bulkages of the balloon were a result of the air being pumped into it.
meanings.sent3: The bulkages of the bread dough surprised the baker as it expanded beyond the pan.
meanings.sent4: The bulkages of the population in the city led to overcrowding issues.
meanings.sent5: The bulkages of the river during the rainy season caused flooding in the area.

meanings.sent1: The bulkages of books in the library made it a paradise for readers.
meanings.sent2: The bulkages of food at the buffet were overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The bulkages of toys in the store delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: The bulkages of clouds in the sky signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The bulkages of data on the computer slowed down its processing speed.
